Articles.Content:
With the advent of the 1.5 update I threw together a plane based on the F-22. It needs the entire runway to take off, but once it\'s in the air it handles *well*.

For comparison:

The real F-22

> ![EefWo.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/EefWo.jpg)

My in-game F-22

> ![ptPLS.png](http://i.imgur.com/ptPLS.png)

I think I did a pretty good job in keeping faithful to the actual design.

Anyway, try it out, and thanks.

Good job.

i nearly got ksp v15 so im gonna try this out.
This thing is surprisingly nimble. Probably need a joystick to fully appreciate it. The roll controls are way touchy on a keyboard.
^^^^^^^^if ur not already, uSe CaPS loCK^^^^^^^^^^^

I have to say that that is one of the best F-22 this forum will probably see.

An excellent reproduction of possibly the sexiest aircraft ever flown. Great work and excellent first post.
got this bad boy up to around 26k meters. but i was going too slow to maintain that altitude(vertical climb). pretty easy aircraft to fly, very stable oddly enough.

Very impressive. How did you get those triangular bits of wing mounted backwards like that? I can\'t rotate them into that position, they always clip into the part I\'m attaching them to when rotated.

> 
> Very impressive. How did you get those triangular bits of wing mounted backwards like that? I can\'t rotate them into that position, they always clip into the part I\'m attaching them to when rotated.

I think he mounted it to the big wing.
I tried that, I can\'t for the life of me mount them in any other orientation than the default without them clipping halfway into other parts.

> 
> I think he mounted it to the big wing.

That\'s exactly what I did. The orientation is odd, so you may need to play around with the position until it works.
Yeah, I figured it out now. It\'s actually super simple, I just kept mucking it up by rotating the parts. Derp.

> 
> I have to say that that is one of the best F-22 this forum will probably see.

Not trying to put it down, but there are still improvements to be made. For example, the tail spike, the fact that the intakes go 1/4 the way up the cockpit, and the fact that the tail fin extends a little bit past the main body. I have an idea on how to do this.
